data.title: Fabián Larrañaga (Larry) on LinkedIn: Keeping this secret for five years wasn’t easy, right Federico Kauffman?…
data.meta_description:
Keeping this secret for five years wasn’t easy, right Federico Kauffman? 😅

We hope you enjoy the story behind our name as much as we've enjoyed it. Stay…
data.text:
On this episode of “JWill’s Thoughts of the Day”: Who are YOU & what is YOUR personal brand? This is something that I think about regularly and it’s always evolving. In a world that places so much value on how others view you, it’s more important to look inward and see how it is that you view yourself first before anyone else can have a say. Find your purpose/mission, develop the narrative, live it, communicate it, socialize it! Dont’t forget to reevaluate and make adjustments as needed👍🏼 Once you develop a strong personal brand, you will never have to worry about what people say when you’re not in the room, you will have already set the narrative for them!💯 By seriously thinking about these things and putting in the WORK, (and let me tell you, it’s not easy) the overall VALUE you will create for yourself will increase! Now, this is a short form version of a much deeper topic! Have you ever thought about your personal brand? Let’s keep the conversation going in the comments!👇

🎨 Wondering what your logo says about your organization? Whether you're aiming for a fun and quirky vibe or a more serious and responsible image, your logo speaks volumes about your brand. In our upcoming episode on The BSS Show, we dive into the significance of logos in your company's Intellectual Property toolkit. If you're yet to create a logo or considering a change, this episode is a must-watch! I'll share invaluable strategies to help you design a logo that aligns perfectly with your brand's voice and personality. Stay tuned for insightful tips and tricks! 🎨Make your brand stand out with the perfect logo? Don't miss this episode on The BSS Show! Your logo is more than just a symbol—it's a reflection of your brand's values and identity. Whether you're aiming for a new-agey vibe or a more traditional look, we've got you covered. Join us as we explore the art and science behind logo design, offering practical strategies to ensure your logo resonates with your target audience. Stay tuned and unlock the secrets to creating a logo that leaves a lasting impression! #LogoCreation #DesignTips #BrandPersonality #BusinessSuccess #CreativeIdeas #TheBSSShow #BrandIdentity #LogoStrategy #IntellectualProperty #MarketingInsights #YouTube

Ready to take your personal brand to the next level and stand out in your industry? Imagine sharing your expertise as a podcast guest or keynote speaker. Heck, maybe you’re already rocking it but are missing that visual presence to bring it all together. Building a brand identity that truly represents your personality, experience, and story is not only fulfilling—it’s a straight up power move 💪 No more letting others define your voice. Don’t settle for a generic logo that doesn’t feel like you. Build that brand that is as unique as you are ✨ The Embody Program is designed for professionals who are ready to take ownership of their personal brand and make a statement in their field. If you want to craft a personal brand that strategically communicates what you do, how you do it, and why you’re so dang driven, we would love to chat 🫶🏼 Visit embermake.com/embody or send us a DM to learn more about how we can support your brand goals ✨ ☻ #personalbranding #personalbrandidentity #personalbrandstrategy

https://lnkd.in/gXdhYizh But what if I told you that design is just as important as words in telling your brand story? Think about it. Your logo, website, social media graphics, even the way your physical store is laid out - all of these elements contribute to your brand's visual identity. And just like a well-written story, your design should be intentional, cohesive, and evoke an emotion in your audience. Crafting Your Brand Story Through Design So, how do you go about crafting a compelling brand story through design? Here are a few tips. Listen to today's Podcast, SUBSCRIBE, LIKE & SHARE

Some branding thoughts for your Monday :) The execution of the new Patreon brand feels a bit on-the-nose to me, but I absolutely love the trend of dynamic, variable visual identities. Patreon's new visuals place an emphasis on adaptability and personalization; crafting an intentional, yet uniquely different experience for each of its audience members. Branding "trends" come and go, but this is one I hope sticks around. It seems to be a natural evolution of the debranding trend, where brand identities were stripped down to their very basics to allow individuals to project their own experiences onto their favorite brands. But as brands get more minimal, what do they stand for? Variable, dynamic brand identities are an incredible option for brands that mean a lot of different things to different people. This is a trend that makes a lot of logical sense, and I hope it sticks around. https://lnkd.in/eXWrY_u4

🙋♀️ Hands up if you sit down and take considerable time to evaluate brand, packaging or marketing design work that comes back from your designer? Recently, a founder from my Brand Growth Heroes Accelerator Programme reached out to me on Whatsapp for feedback on 3 versions of new label designs. 🎤 Listen to my (hopefully you'll agree helpful) answer by clicking play on the video below! --> Referring back to the objectives set in the brand or packaging design brief is KEY before responding to the designer's work --> This means you need to have: 1. thought through and crafted clear objectives and 2. written a clear brief 😉 --> Care of thought ensures we ask the right people to give us feedback on the work, based on what it aims to achieve. --> Make sure you don't fall into the 'personal preference trap'. Yes personal preference is important, but only once you've ticked the 'does the work deliver against the objectives in the brief' box! --> Also...put yourself in your designer's shoes! If they've spent time crafting the work, then we should spend time evaluating it against what we asked them to deliver. Hands up if you try to rush evaluating brand design work too often? #packaging #branddesign #brandgrowthheroes (In our latest episode of Brand Growth Heroes, Camilla Barnard of Rude Health and I discuss brand and packaging design in detail. Have a listen and don't forget to click follow so you don't miss our next episode coming very soon)
